  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** Long identifiers, used in parsetree.

  18.   {b Warning:} this module is unstable and part of
  19.   {{!Compiler_libs}compiler-libs}.

  21.   To print a longident, see {!Pprintast.longident}, using
  22.     {!Format.asprintf} to convert to a string.

  24. *)

  26. ‌type t =
  27.     Lident of string
  28.   | Ldot of t * string
  29.   | Lapply of t * t

  31. ‌val flatten: t -> string list
  32. ‌val unflatten: string list -> t option
  33. (** For a non-empty list [l], [unflatten l] is [Some lid] where [lid] is
  34.     the long identifier created by concatenating the elements of [l]
  35.     with [Ldot].
  36.     [unflatten []] is [None].
  37. *)

  39. ‌val last: t -> string
  40. ‌val parse: string -> t
  41. [@@deprecated "this function may misparse its input,\n\
  42. use \"Parse.longident\" or \"Longident.unflatten\""]
  43. (**

  45.    This function is broken on identifiers that are not just "Word.Word.word";
  46.    for example, it returns incorrect results on infix operators
  47.    and extended module paths.

  49.    If you want to generate long identifiers that are a list of
  50.    dot-separated identifiers, the function {!unflatten} is safer and faster.
  51.    {!unflatten} is available since OCaml 4.06.0.

  53.    If you want to parse any identifier correctly, use the long-identifiers
  54.    functions from the {!Parse} module, in particular {!Parse.longident}.
  55.    They are available since OCaml 4.11, and also provide proper
  56.    input-location support.

  58. *)
